declarations.description:
A custom element that represents a button without background for a search.
It sends a custom event "click" when clicked.
It exists to have already styled button for secondary actions.
You can modify this variable to customize the button style :
--button-transparent-padding
--secondary-hover-color
declarations.name: SearchaliciousButtonTransparent

slots.description: This slot is for the button contents, default to "Search" string.

declarations.description: An error thrown if we don't have a template in results component
declarations.name: MissingResultTemplateError

declarations.description: An error thrown if we have multiple templates in results component
declarations.name: MultipleResultTemplateError

declarations.description:
Search autocomplete that can be used in facets to add terms that are not yet displayed (because they haven't enough elements).
It supports adding terms from suggested options but also terms that are not suggested.
Options are provided by the parent facet component that listen to `autocomplete-input` events to get input and fetch options accordingly
As a value is selected, an `autocomplete-submit` event is emitted so that parent facet can add the new value.
declarations.name: SearchaliciousAutocomplete

slots.description: This slot is for the button contents, default to "Search" string.

members.name: _renderSuggestions
members.description: Renders the possiblibility as list for user to select from

members.name: handleInput
members.description: This method is used to handle the input value.

members.name: submit

parameters.name: isSuggestion
parameters.description: A boolean value to check if the value is a suggestion or a free input from the user.

members.description:
This method is used to submit the input value.
It is used to submit the input value after selecting an option.

members.name: options
members.description:
The options for the suggestion.
It is provided by the parent component.

members.name: getOptionIndex
members.description:
This method is used to get the current index.
It remove the offset of 1 because the currentIndex is 1-based.

members.name: onInput
members.description: Handles the input event on the suggestion and dispatch custom event : "suggestion-input".

members.name: blurInput
members.description:
This method is used to remove focus from the input element.
It is used to quit after selecting an option.

members.name: resetInput
members.description:
This method is used to reset the input value and blur it.
It is used to reset the input after a search.

members.name: handleArrowKey

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the arrow key event.

members.description: Handles keyboard event to navigate the suggestion list

members.name: handleEnter
members.description:
When Enter is pressed:
  * if an option was selected (using keyboard arrows) it becomes the value
  * otherwise the input string is the value
We then submit the value.

members.name: handleEscape
members.description: This method is used to handle the escape key event.

members.name: onKeyDown
members.description: dispatch key events according to the key pressed (arrows or enter)

members.name: onClick
members.description: On a click on the suggestion option, we select it as value and submit it.

members.name: onFocus
members.description:
This method is used to handle the focus event on the input element.
It is used to show the suggestion options when the input is focused.

members.name: onBlur
members.description:
This method is used to handle the blur event on the input element.
It is used to hide the suggestion options when the input is blurred.
It is debounced to avoid to quit before select with click.

declarations.description:
The search bar element

This is the main component, it will enable the input of the search query
and it also manage all the search thanks to SearchaliciousSearchMixin inheritance.
declarations.name: SearchaliciousBar

declarations.description:
It is a transparent button that is used to reset the search.
It use the signal canResetSearch to know if it should be displayed.
declarations.name: SearchaliciousResetButton

declarations.description:
The search results element

It will display results based upon the slot with name `result`,
considered as a template, with variable interpolation (using tag-params library).

It reacts to the `searchalicious-result` event fired by the search controller.
declarations.name: SearchaliciousResults

members.name: parentWidth
members.description: The parent width, used to compute the number of loading cards to display

members.name: resultRenderer
members.description:
A function rendering a single result. We define this just to get it's prototype right.

It will be replaced by a dynamic function created
from the content of the slot named result.

Note that we need to pass along html, because at rendering time, it will not be available as a global

members.name: noResults
members.description:
HTML to display when there are no results

Can be overridden by a "no-results" slot

members.name: beforeSearch
members.description:
HTML to display before anysearch is launched

Can be overridden by a "before-search" slot

members.name: _buildResultRenderer
members.description:
Build a result renderer from the template provided by user.
It creates dynamically a function that renders the template with the given result and index.
This is the best way I could find !
It is faster as using eval as the function is built only once at component creation time.

members.name: _getTemplate
members.description:
Get the template for one result, using `<slot name="<name>">`
This must be run before shadowRoot is constructed ! (to be able to grab this.innerHTML)

members.name: renderLoading
members.description:
Render the loading cards
We display 2 columns of loading cards

declarations.description:
A component to add a specific sort option which is based upon a script

See [How to use scripts](./how-to-use-scripts) for an introduction
declarations.name: SearchaliciousSortScript

cssProperties.description: --sort-options-color - The text color of the sort options.
--sort-options-hover-background-color - The background color of the sort options when hovered.

cssParts.description: the text before the selected option
cssParts.name: selected-marker

cssParts.description: the sort option itself, when not selected
cssParts.name: sort-option

cssParts.description: the sort option itself, when selected
cssParts.name: sort-option-selected

slots.description: the content is rendered as is. This is the line displayed for the user to choose from sort options

members.name: script
members.description:
Name of the script to use for the sorting.

This script must be registered in your backend configuration file.

members.name: parameters
members.description:
The parameters to pass to the scripts.

If the script requires no parameters, this can be an empty Object `'{}'`

It can be either:
- a JSON string containing parameters
- a local storage key, with prefix `local:`.
  In this case, the value of the key must be a JSON string.

members.name: getDefaultId
members.description: Create a sensible default id for this sort option

members.name: getScriptParameters
members.description: Get the sort parameters according to parameters

members.name: getSortParameters
members.description: Properties to add to query to be able to sort on this specific script
by default the id is based upon the script name. If you have more than one element with the same value for the `script` attribute, you must provide an id.
members.name: id
selected
members.description:
If the value is selected.
Only one value should be selected at once in a sort component.

members.name: selectedMarker
members.description: A text or symbol to display in front of the currently selected option

events.description: Fired when the sort option is selected.
events.name: searchalicious-sort-option-selected

declarations.description:
`searchalicious-sort-field` is a sort option that sorts on a field.

It must be used inside a `searchalicious-sort` component.
declarations.name: SearchaliciousSortField

cssProperties.description: --sort-options-color - The text color of the sort options.
--sort-options-hover-background-color - The background color of the sort options when hovered.

cssParts.description: the text before the selected option
cssParts.name: selected-marker

cssParts.description: the sort option itself, when not selected
cssParts.name: sort-option

cssParts.description: the sort option itself, when selected
cssParts.name: sort-option-selected

slots.description: the content is rendered as is. This is the line displayed for the user to choose from sort options

members.name: field
members.description:
The field name we want to sort on. It must be a sortable field.

If you want to sort on the field in reverse order, use a minus sign in front of the field name.

members.name: getDefaultId
members.description: id defaults to field-<field-name>

members.name: getSortParameters
members.description: This is the method that should return the sort paratemetrs

members.name: selected
members.description:
If the value is selected.
Only one value should be selected at once in a sort component.

members.name: selectedMarker
members.description: A text or symbol to display in front of the currently selected option

events.description: Fired when the sort option is selected.
events.name: searchalicious-sort-option-selected

attributes.name: field

The field name we want to sort on. It must be a sortable field.

If you want to sort on the field in reverse order, use a minus sign in front of the field name.

attributes.name: selected

If the value is selected.
Only one value should be selected at once in a sort component.

attributes.name: selectedMarker

declarations.description:
A custom element that represents a secondary button for a search.
It sends a custom event "click" when clicked.
You can modify this variable to customize the button style :
- --secondary-button-padding
declarations.name: SearchaliciousSecondaryButton

slots.description: This slot is for the button contents, default to "Reset" string.

members.name: _dispatchEvent
members.description: Dispatches a secondary event.

members.name: _onClick
members.description: Handles the click event on the secondary button.

members.name: _onKeyUp
members.description: Handles the keyup event on the secondary button to dispatch secondary event.

declarations.name: getDefaultSearchResultDetail

Payload for searchResult signal, before we launch any search

isSearchLaunch is false

declarations.name: canResetSearch

Function to get the signal to indicate if the search has changed.
It is use by reset-button to know if it should be displayed.

declarations.description:
Function to get the signal to indicate if the search has changed.
it is used by the search button to know if it should be displayed.

declarations.name: searchResultDetail
declarations.description:
Get the SearcResultDetail signal based on search name.

If the no search was yet launch, return a detail corresponding to no search

declarations.name: isSearchLoading

Function to get the signal to indicate if the search is loading.
The search-results utilize this to determine whether the loading card should be displayed.

declarations.description:
This component enables sharing state about panels in a central place.

it should be high in the hierarchy (just below `body`)
to wrap all other web-components

It must be used if you want to use the `searchalicious-layout-page` component

It allows to have a global variable to store with @lit/context
declarations.name: SearchaliciousPanelManager

members.name: chartSideBarState
members.description:
State of the chart sidebar
Each LitElement that needs to know the state of the sidebar should consume this context
By default, the chart sidebar is opened

attributes.name: chart-sidebar-state
attributes.description:
State of the chart sidebar
Each LitElement that needs to know the state of the sidebar should consume this context
By default, the chart sidebar is opened

declarations.name: DebounceMixin
declarations.description:
A mixin class for debouncing function calls.
It extends the LitElement class and adds debouncing functionality.
It is used to prevent a function from being called multiple times in a short period of time.
It is usefull to avoid multiple calls to a function when the user is typing in an input field.

Mixin to handle the history of the search
It exists to have the logic of the history in a single place
It has to be inherited by SearchaliciousSearchMixin to implement _facetsNodes and _facetsFilters functionss
declarations.name: SearchaliciousHistoryMixin

members.name: convertHistoryParamsToValues
members.description:
Convert the URL params to the original values
It will be used to set the values from the URL

members.name: setValuesFromHistory
members.description:
Set the values from the history
It will set the params from the URL params

members.name: buildHistoryParams
members.description:
Build the history params from the current state
It will be used to update the URL when searching

members.name: setParamFromUrl
members.description:
Set the values from the URL
It will set the values from the URL and return if a search should be launched

declarations.description:
A mixin class for search actions.
It extends the LitElement class and adds search functionality.
It is used to launch a search event.
declarations.name: SearchActionMixin

members.name: searchName
members.description:
The name of the search bar this sort applies to.

It must correspond to the `name` property of the corresponding `search-bar` component.

It enable having multiple search bars on the same page.

It defaults to `searchalicious`

members.name: _launchSearch
members.description:
Launches a search event.
It creates a new event with the search name and dispatches it.

attributes.name: search-name
attributes.description:
The name of the search bar this sort applies to.

It must correspond to the `name` property of the corresponding `search-bar` component.

It enable having multiple search bars on the same page.

It defaults to `searchalicious`

to trigger a search.
It must have the search name in it's data.

to ask for page change

declarations.description:
This mixin handles the logic of having a list of suggestion,
and letting the user choose on suggestion.

It factors the interaction logic but does not deal with the rendering.
declarations.name: SuggestionSelectionMixin

members.name: options
members.description:
The options for the suggestion.
It is provided by the parent component.

members.name: getOptionIndex
members.description:
This method is used to get the current index.
It remove the offset of 1 because the currentIndex is 1-based.

members.name: onInput
members.description: Handles the input event on the suggestion and dispatch custom event : "suggestion-input".

members.name: blurInput
members.description:
This method is used to remove focus from the input element.
It is used to quit after selecting an option.

members.name: resetInput
members.description:
This method is used to reset the input value and blur it.
It is used to reset the input after a search.

members.name: submit

parameters.name: isSuggestion
parameters.description: A boolean value to check if the value is a suggestion.

members.description:
This method is used to submit the input value.
It is used to submit the input value after selecting an option.

members.name: handleArrowKey

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the arrow key event.

members.description: Handles keyboard event to navigate the suggestion list

members.name: handleEnter
members.description:
When Enter is pressed:
  * if an option was selected (using keyboard arrows) it becomes the value
  * otherwise the input string is the value
We then submit the value.

members.name: handleEscape
members.description: This method is used to handle the escape key event.

members.name: onKeyDown
members.description: dispatch key events according to the key pressed (arrows or enter)

members.name: onClick
members.description: On a click on the suggestion option, we select it as value and submit it.

members.name: onFocus
members.description:
This method is used to handle the focus event on the input element.
It is used to show the suggestion options when the input is focused.

members.name: onBlur
members.description:
This method is used to handle the blur event on the input element.
It is used to hide the suggestion options when the input is blurred.
It is debounced to avoid to quit before select with click.

Remove parenthesis from a string
for example: "(test OR test2)" => "test OR test2"

Add a prefix to a string
for example: addParamPrefix('test', 'off') => 'off_test'

Remove a prefix from a string
for example: removeParamPrefix('off_test', 'off') => 'test'
